body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}


In this conversation, the agent's name is Anthony Kelly and the customer's name is Shirley Bryant.  The conversation is about MetaCar (a Car Rental Agency ) and is a conversation about customer service.The customer is feeling {emotion}.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello! Welcome to MetaCar. My name is Anthony Kelly, and I'm here to assist you today.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: It's great to meet you, Shirley! How can I help you today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: I'm feeling a bit frustrated with my recent car rental experience.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: I’m sorry to hear that you’re feeling frustrated. Can you please provide me with your booking reference number?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Sure, it’s one two three four five six.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for that. Could you also provide me with the date of your rental?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: It was on the fifteenth of October, twenty twenty-three.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, Shirley. I will look into your booking and see what went wrong. Please hold on for a moment.

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Okay, thank you for your help.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: I appreciate your patience, Shirley. Thank you for your time, and if you need anything else, don’t hesitate to reach out!
